# üöÄ feature request

### Relevant Package
<!-- Can you pin-point one or more @angular/* packages the are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: --> This feature request is for @angular/core


### Description
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è-->
It would be useful for `ViewRef` to have a reference to the enclosing `ViewContainerRef` to which the `ViewRef` is (possibly) attached to. 

An example use case is moving dynamic components around between different `ViewContainerRef`s. Depending on the underlying data structure model of the components, it might be cumbersome to have to keep a reference to the enclosing `ViewContainerRef` on the application side.

### Describe the solution you'd like
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è-->
```TypeScript
// assume the following vars were previously created and have the following types:
// dynamicallyCreatedComponent: ComponentRef
// newViewContainerRef: ViewContainerRef
const oldViewContainerRef = dynamicallyCreatedComponent.hostView.enclosingViewContainerRef // the feature request is for something similar to this "enclosingViewContainerRef" property
const indexInOldViewContainer = oldViewContainerRef.indexOf(dynamicallyCreatedComponent.hostView)
oldViewContainerRef.detach(indexInOldViewContainer) // necessary because components have to be detached before they can be reinserted.
newViewContainerRef.insert(dynamicallyCreatedComponent.hostView)
```

### Describe alternatives you've considered
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> The current workaround is to keep a reference to the enclosing ViewContainerRef inside the component instance, and update it whenever it changes (i.e whenever the component is moved to another ViewContainerRef).
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Reference to enclosing ViewContainerRef as a property in ViewRef" (#32925)

child components could insert a template from the host that contains the result
of the ViewQuery function (see related test added in this PR).

Issues.Title: fix(ngcc): handle presence of both `ctorParameters` and `__decorate`
Issues.Body:
Recently ng-packagr was updated to include a transform that used to be
done in tsickle (https://github.com/ng-packagr/ng-packagr/pull/1401),
where only constructor parameter decorators are emitted in tsickle's
format, not any of the other decorators.

ngcc used to extract decorators from only a single format, so once it 
saw the `ctorParameters` static property it assumed the library is using
the tsickle format. Therefore, none of the `__decorate` calls were
considered. This resulted in missing decorator information, preventing 
proper processing of a package.

This commit changes how decorators are extracted by always looking at 
both the static properties and the `__decorate` calls, merging these 
sources appropriately.

Resolves FW-1573
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(ngcc): handle presence of both `ctorParameters` and `__decorate`" (#32901)

Issues.Title: fix(ngcc): ensure private exports are added for `ModuleWithProviders`
Issues.Body:
ngcc may need to insert public exports into the bundle's source as well
as to the entry-point's declaration file, as the Ivy compiler may need
to create import statements to internal library types. The way ngcc
knows which exports to add is through the references registry, to which
references to things that require a public export are added by the
various analysis steps that are executed.

One of these analysis steps is the augmentation of declaration files
where functions that return `ModuleWithProviders` are updated so that a
generic type argument is added that corresponds with the `NgModule` that
is actually imported. This type has to be publicly exported, so the
analyzer step has to add the module type to the references registry.

A problem occurs when `ModuleWithProviders` already has a generic type
argument, in which case no update of the declaration file is necessary.
This may happen when 1) ngcc is processing additional bundle formats, so
that the declaration file has already been updated while processing the
first bundle format, or 2) when a package is processed which already
contains the generic type in its source. In both scenarios it may occur
that the referenced `NgModule` type does not yet have a public export,
so it is crucial that a reference to the type is added to the
references registry, which ngcc failed to do.

This commit fixes the issue by always adding the referenced `NgModule`
type to the references registry, so that a public export will always be
created if necessary.

Resolves FW-1575
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(ngcc): ensure private exports are added for `ModuleWithProviders`" (#32902)

Issues.Title: perf(ivy): speed up prop-based style/class bindings when no directives are present
Issues.Body:
Prior to this fix, whenever a prop-based style or class binding is
present, the binding application process would require an instance of
`TStylingContext` to be built regardless of whether or not any binding
resolution is needed (just so that it knows whether or not there are
any collisions). This check is, however, unncessary because if (and only
if) there are directives present on the element then are collisions
possible.

This patch removes the need for style/class bindings to register
themselves on to a `TStylingContext` if there are no directives and
no map-based bindings present on an element. This means that all
prop-based style/class bindings are applied directly as soon as the
first update pass is rendered on an element.

Issues.Title: Feature to cancel Pending HTTP requests in Angular Interceptor
Issues.Body:
<!--üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ
### Description
I was able to abort pending requests using TakeUntil Operator in Angular. 
However, upon aborting a request, if takeUntil would return partial response instead of returning a Null.  Checking the network call would show the call as cancelled/aborted (for example, if you requested to load a data table and you abort the HTTP request before the response is made, you would we partial data in the table. I am expecting to no or null data.  

Oh hi there! üòÑ 

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ-->


# üöÄ feature request

### Relevant Package
import {Injectable} from "@angular/core";
import {
  HttpErrorResponse,
  HttpEvent,
  HttpHandler,
  HttpInterceptor,
  HttpRequest,
  HttpResponse
} from "@angular/common/http";
import {Observable, throwError} from "rxjs";
import {catchError, finalize, takeUntil, tap} from "rxjs/operators";
import {LoadingStatus} from "../service/loading-status.service";
import {of} from "rxjs/internal/observable/of";
import {environment} from "../../../environments/environment"


### Description
I was able to abort pending requests using TakeUntil Operator in Angular. 
However, upon aborting a request, if takeUntil would return partial response instead of returning a Null.  Checking the network call would show the call as cancelled/aborted (for example, if you requested to load a data table and you abort the HTTP request before the response is made, you would we partial data in the table. I am expecting to no or null data.  

### Describe the solution you'd like
1. One way to do this is add an if at every single call and unsubscribe. 


###Example Code:
intercept(req: HttpRequest<any>, next: HttpHandler): Observable<HttpEvent<any>> {
    let id = String(this.httpCallCount++);
    this._loadingStatus.loadStarted(id);
    let response: Observable<HttpEvent<any>>;
    if (environment.enableCaching) {
      response = this.handleWithCaching(req, next);
    } else {
      response = next.handle(req);
    }

    return response.pipe(
      finalize(() => this._loadingStatus.loadFinished(id)),
      takeUntil(this._loadingStatus.onCancelPendingRequests())
    );
  }

  handleWithCaching(req: HttpRequest<any>, next: HttpHandler): Observable<HttpEvent<any>> {
    const id = req.urlWithParams,
          lastResponse = this.storage.getItem(id);
    if (lastResponse) {
      let response = JSON.parse(lastResponse);
      return of(new HttpResponse({
        body: response.body,
        headers: response.headers,
        status: response.status,
        statusText: response.statusText,
        url: response.url
      }))
    } else {
      return next.handle(req).takeUntil(this._loadingStatus.onCancelPendingRequests()).pipe(
        tap(res => {
          if (res instanceof HttpResponse) {
            this.storage.setItem(id, JSON.stringify(res))
          }
        },
          catchError((error: HttpErrorResponse) => {
            let data: {};
            data = {
              message: error.message,
            };
            console.log(error);
            return throwError(error);
          }
        ),
      ));
    }
  }
}
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Feature to cancel Pending HTTP requests in Angular Interceptor" (#32918)

Issues.Title: SCSS imports error upgrading from 8.3.1 to Ivy
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/core ### Is this a regression? Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: 8.3.1 ### Description Running the below command produces an error when attempting to upgrade to Ivy `ng update @angular/cli@next @angular/core@next --force` ## üî• Exception or Error > ** Executing migrations for version 9.0.0-beta of package '@angular/core' ** > ------ Missing @Injectable migration ------ > Successfully migrated all undecorated providers. > ------------------------------------------- > ** Executing migrations for version 9.0.0-beta of package '@angular/core' ** > ------ Renderer to Renderer2 Migration ------ > As of Angular 9, the Renderer class is no longer available. > Renderer2 should be used instead. > ** Executing migrations for version 9.0.0-beta of package '@angular/core' ** > ------ Undecorated classes with decorated fields migration ------ > As of Angular 9, it is no longer supported to have Angular field decorators on a class that does not have an Angular decorator. > ** Executing migrations for version 9.0.0-beta of package '@angular/core' ** > ------ Undecorated classes with DI migration ------ > > This migration uses the Angular compiler internally and therefore projects that no longer build successfully after the update cannot run the migration. Please ensure there are no AOT compilation errors and rerun the migration.. The following project failed: src/tsconfig.app.json > > Error: error TS100: Couldn't resolve resource modules/breakpoints from [removed for privacy reasons]/real-estate-client/src/app/public-core/nav/nav.component.scss > > > Migration can be rerun with: "ng update @angular/core --from 8.0.0 --to 9.0.0 --migrate-only" > Successfully migrated all found undecorated classes > that use dependency injection. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction I believe this is because of my angular.json configuration. It's currently using **include paths** for SCSS file imports (so I don't have to type the entire path from the project root whenever I want to import scss files from component styles) ``` "stylePreprocessorOptions": { "includePaths": [ "src/assets/scss" ] }, ``` For some reason the migration can't seem to find the imported files and just crashes as shown. To reproduce it, simply create a new angular project with SCSS preset, change the **stylePreprocessorOptions** in angular.json as shown above and try to run `ng update @angular/cli@next @angular/core@next --force` ## üåç Your Environment (after attempting to run the migration command) **Angular Version:** 



Angular CLI: 9.0.0-next.6
Node: 12.3.1

Issues.Title: UI and form values are not in sync
Issues.Body:
### Affected Package
ReactiveFormsModule / FormGroup Packages as the source of the bug:
 @angular/forms
The issue is caused by package @angular/forms

### Description
When one drop down is dependent on another, If we are changing values based on first drop down, the object of FormGroup "fg" will keep the previously selected value of second drop down though we have updated the values and HTML content is showing some another values, and the values preserved is no longer part of any drop down then after. 
We need to forcefully reset the value of that object which is not realistic. Form object should preserve the values if exist. but your UI is changed now, ts file is also contains new values. 

When i am imposing validation on the second drop down, and it is not selected, yet i am able to submit the form with previously selected (historic) value, second drop down is required to select, and html shows it empty but yet form is getting submitted with empty value.

## Minimal Reproduction
Editor URL: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-yuxk9b
App URL: https://angular-yuxk9b.stackblitz.io
Embed URL: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-yuxk9b?xmbed=1&file=src/app/app.component.html

## Environment
Angular Version:
8.3.5

Issues.Title: Handling each chuncked http response separately
Issues.Body:
```
[ ] Regression (a behavior that used to work and stopped working in a new release)
[ ] Bug report  
[ ] Performance issue
[X] Feature request
[ ] Documentation issue or request
[ ] Support request => Please do not submit support request here, instead see https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#question
[ ] Other... Please describe:
```
This feature request is for @angular/common/http/HttpRequest


### Description
The HttpResponse with chunked transfer encoding should be served individually rather than a block of previous + current response. The same request was made by another user here: https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/26289 . Unfortunately that issue was closed without a satisfactory solution, although it was supported by several other users. Currently there is a double penalty processing streams of chunked responses from angular, concatenating the responses and then processing the block of responses to extract the last event using interceptors. 

### Describe the solution you'd like
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> Maybe the introduction of an option to chose how an user prefers to handle these kind of responses would solve this.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Handling each chuncked http response separately" (#32906)

Issues.Title: feat(@schematics/angular): update browser output path when adding universal
Issues.Body:
Currently, in the CLI universal schematic we are setting the server output path to `dist/project-server` and not amending the build outputPath

Ex:
```
dist/project
dist/project-server
```

However, the above paths are being update when adding `nguniversal` to the below:

```
dist/project/browser
dist/project/server
```

With this change it is proposed to move that logic to upstream.

Related PR to clean up nguniversal schematics https://github.com/angular/universal/pull/1265
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "feat(@schematics/angular): update browser output path when adding universal" (#15717)

Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: @angular-devkit/build-angular: 0.802.x ### Description When upgrading to @angular-devkit/build-angular:0.803.x from 0.802.x the `--statsJson` build flag no longer produces `stats-es5.json` it only produces `stats-es2015.json` ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction - run `ng new test-app` - `cd test-app` - run `ng build --statsJson` - dist/test-app no longer includes stats-es5.json ## üî• Exception or Error

Issues.Title: feat(@angular-devkit/build-angular): set document locale with i18n
Issues.Body:
When using i18n (`i18nLocale`), set the document locale in `index.html` using the html `lang` attribute.

Fixes #8102

Issues.Title: referenceError, even when using "if"
Issues.Body:
in JS we can do:
`if(x){doSomething()} //if 'x' is not defined, this line is ignored, but will not give a referenceError`

but in angular schematics, it gives a referenceError `x is not defined`

`<% if(x){x} %>`

it is difficult to define all variables before passing it to the template using template({...})
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "referenceError, even when using "if"" (#15715)

Issues.Title: ng e2e --baseUrl=http://example/ is not provided to protractor
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) ``` - [ ] new - [ ] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ x ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ``` ### Is this a regression? Yes, it worked in Version 7.3 ### Description Providing the baseUrl as parameter is not provided to protractor config. It gets overriden by undefined. That happens because in https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/8.3.x/packages/angular_devkit/build_angular/src/protractor/index.ts at commit https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/commit/7bd59980e4cc200cedd9c8666d8210ff928d3719 line 95 `baseUrl` is instantiated without providing a value, so it is undefined. It would only be overriden if devServerTarget is set. Then on line 149 protractor gets called with the baseUrl set to undefined, so the baseUrl from options gets overridden with undefined. ``` return await runProtractor(context.workspaceRoot, { ...options, baseUrl }); ``` To solve this, it would be enough to initialize baseUrl with options.baseUrl: `let baseUrl = options.baseUrl` ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction ### protractor.conf.js ``` // Protractor configuration file, see link for more information // https://github.com/angular/protractor/blob/master/lib/config.ts exports.config = { allScriptsTimeout: 11000, specs: [ './src/**/*.e2e-spec.ts' ], capabilities: { 'browserName': 'chrome', chromeOptions: { args: ["--headless", "--disable-gpu", "--incognito", "--window-size=1920,1200"] } }, params: { base: '.' }, directConnect: true, framework: 'jasmine', jasmineNodeOpts: { showColors: true, defaultTimeoutInterval: 30000, print: function () { } }, onPrepare() { console.log('onPrepare'); console.log('baseUrl', browser.baseUrl); // Should log the provided baseUrl to the console }, }; ``` Executing `ng e2e --baseUrl=http://test.local/TICKET-1234` logs ``` onPrepare baseUrl ``` ## üî• Exception or Error All tests fail with wait timeouts, because baseUrl is undefined and browser.get complains about an invalid argument ``` - Failed: invalid argument (Session info: headless chrome=77.0.3865.75) (Driver info: chromedriver=77.0.3865.40 (f484704e052e0b556f8030b65b953dce96503217-refs/branch-heads/3865@{#442}),platform=Windows NT 10.0.17763 x86_64) (Session info: headless chrome=77.0.3865.75) (Driver info: chromedriver=77.0.3865.40 (f484704e052e0b556f8030b65b953dce96503217-refs/branch-heads/3865@{#442}),platform=Windows NT 10.0.17763 x86_64) at Object.checkLegacyResponse (xxx\node_modules\selenium-webdriver\lib\error.js:546:15) at parseHttpResponse (xxx\node_modules\selenium-webdriver\lib\http.js:509:13) at doSend.then.response (xxx\node_modules\selenium-webdriver\lib\http.js:441:30) at process._tickCallback (internal/process/next_tick.js:68:7) From: Task: WebDriver.navigate().to(http://localhost:1289012/) ``` ## üåç Your Environment

Issues.Title: When do ng new <project> --minimal, it should include tslint.json file as well.
Issues.Body:
<!--üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ

Oh hi there! üòÑ

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ-->


# üöÄ Feature request


### Command (mark with an `x`)
<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: -->
```
- [x] new
- [ ] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
```

### Description
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> A clear and concise description of the problem or missing capability...
When doing new new project with `--minimal`, it doesn't include `tslint.json` file. It will make vscode complain a lot.

### Describe the solution you'd like
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> If you have a solution in mind, please describe it.
Include `tslint.json` file even with minimal project creation.

### Describe alternatives you've considered

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/build-optimizer): fix error when `__decorate` has‚Ä¶
Issues.Body:
‚Ä¶ no `__metadata`

When a `__decorator` expression has no `__metadata` call, example:

```js
__decorate([
    ContentChild('heading', { read: ElementRef, static: true })
], FooBarComponent.prototype, "buttons", void 0);
```

A `Cannot read property 'kind' of undefined` error will be thrown.

Closes: #15703

Issues.Title: build: update terser to version 4.3.4
Issues.Body:
This PR contains the following updates:

| Package | Type | Update | Change |
|---|---|---|---|
| [terser](https://terser.org) ([source](https://togithub.com/terser/terser)) | dependencies | patch | [`4.3.2` -> `4.3.4`](https://renovatebot.com/diffs/npm/terser/4.3.2/4.3.4) |

---

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>terser/terser</summary>

### [`v4.3.4`](https://togithub.com/terser/terser/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#v434)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/terser/terser/compare/v4.3.3...v4.3.4)

-   Fixed a regression where the output size was increased when unused classes were referred to in the extends clause of a class.
-   Small typescript typings fixes.
-   Comments with `@preserve`, `@license`, `@cc_on` as well as comments starting with `/*!` and `/**!` are now preserved by default.

### [`v4.3.3`](https://togithub.com/terser/terser/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#v433)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/terser/terser/compare/v4.3.2...v4.3.3)

-   Fixed a problem where parsing template strings would mix up octal notation and a slash followed by a zero representing a null character.
-   Started accepting the name `async` in destructuring arguments with default value.
-   Now Terser takes into account side effects inside class `extends` clauses.
-   Added parens whenever there's a comment between a return statement and the returned value, to prevent issues with ASI.
-   Stopped using raw RegExp objects, since the spec is going to continue to evolve. This ensures Terser is able to process new, unknown RegExp flags and features. This is a breaking change in the AST node AST_RegExp.

</details>

##### Features

-   **builtin:** detect APF node module format if ANGULAR_PACKAGE file found ([#​1112](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/issues/1112)) ([162e436](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/commit/162e436))

-   **rollup:** new implementation of rollup_bundle in [@​bazel/rollup](https://togithub.com/bazel/rollup) package ([3873715](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/commit/3873715)), closes [#​532](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/issues/532) [#​724](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/issues/724)

-   **rollup:** tests and docs for new rollup_bundle ([cfef773](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/commit/cfef773))
-   **terser:** support directory inputs ([21b5142](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/commit/21b5142))

Issues.Title: Moment date adapter with Material datepicker strict mode issue
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Use StackBlitz to reproduce your issue: 
https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-qn3txm

Steps to reproduce:
1. Strict mode for moment adapter is turned on in app.module providers section
2. valuechanges is set up at the form
3. When user starts typing in date, for instance types in "10" and stops, the valuechanges should fire with the value of Moment date object being invalid (invalid: true).
4. Currently it fires with the Moment date value being expanded to 10/01/2019, making it valid date. Now, this could be ok behaviour prior we had the strict mode or when strict mode is off but not when it is turned on.
 
#### Expected Behavior

For incomplete dates entered into the form the Datepicker/Moment date adapter currently works in a way of "autocompleting" the value to the current month, which is unwanted when strict mode in turned on.

#### Actual Behavior

If user enters "10" currently the datepicker/dateadapter expands it to 10/1/2019 (for default en-us locale being in use). Even when strict mode is on.

#### What behavior were you expecting to see?

The Moment value from the datepicker value should be invalid (or maybe null).

#### Environment

- Angular: 8.2.8
- CDK/Material: 8.2.1
- Browser(s): latest chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu):  Windows 10
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Moment date adapter with Material datepicker strict mode issue" (#17235)

Issues.Title: fix(cdk-experimental/clipboard): avoid changing layout with temporary textarea
Issues.Body:
Currently the clipboard service creates a temporary invisible `textarea` from which to copy the text into the clipboard, however since it only has `opacity: 0`, it has the potential of changing the layout in a noticeable way if it is present for longer.

These changes add some extra styles to avoid changing the layout. I also did some small cleanup to make it a bit more robust.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(cdk-experimental/clipboard): avoid changing layout with temporary textarea" (#17227)

Issues.Title: build: add workaround for bug breaking ts_library hermeticity
Issues.Body:
Patches `@bazel/typescript` to not be non-hermetic. We need to
work around this because it impacts the Bazel development workflow
significantly if file changes sometimes need a `bazel clean`
(basically breaking incrementality).

Issue is reported with in-depth details: https://github.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/issues/1208. I wanted to go for a fix, but apparently it involves a bigger discussion and is probably blocked by G3 syncs, so a workaround through postinstall seems reasonable for now.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "build: add workaround for bug breaking ts_library hermeticity" (#17225)

Issues.Title: Add @Input to allow a custom class to be added to HTML elements that are directly replaced by mat- components
Issues.Body:
#### Feature Description

For mat-* elements that replace HTML elements directly (i.e. mat-checkbox, mat-select), the ability to apply a class to the base element via an @Input or other property would add options for interacting with third-party libraries that are not directly compatible.

Note that this functionality would be similar to the panelClass implementations on other material components (e.g. [MatSnackBar](https://material.angular.io/components/snack-bar/api))

#### Use Case

Consider this example using the angular2-hotkeys library:

[](https://components-issue-qi8zq1.stackblitz.io/)

The library (based on the Mousetrap library) contains logic that prevents hotkey events from propagating when an `input`, `textarea`, or `select` element is focused. By design this can be bypassed if the "mousetrap" class is added to the target element. In the example above, you can see that adding the class to a mat-checkbox is insufficient for bypassing this logic as it must be on the base input element explicitly. Currently there is no way of doing that declaratively, so the hacky solution involves accessing the VIewChild through a (presumably) hidden property and manually adding it at runtime.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Add @Input to allow a custom class to be added to HTML elements that are directly replaced by mat- components" (#17238)

Issues.Title: OverlayPositionBuilder: Overlay position is not correct for some configurations
Issues.Body: #### Reproduction Minimal example: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-overlay-bug Steps to reproduce: 1. Open the Stackblitz link ‚Üí position of overlay is wrong 2. Comment out lines 32-37 in `app.component.ts` ‚Üí position of overlay is correct (blue overlay should be visible on the right side of the red block) #### Screenshots Overlapped screenshots of the two position configurations from Stackblitz: Screenshot of inspect mode with cubes to demonstrate the different spacing: The incorrect placement can be achieved by setting ``` { originX: 'start', overlayX: 'end', ... } ``` in the `withPositions` function of `OverlayPositionBuilder`. The options for `originY` and `overlayY` do not matter in this case. #### Expected Behavior The overlay is positioned correctly for each position configuration. #### Actual Behavior The overlay is positioned too far to the right, when `originX` is set to 'start' and `overlayX` to 'end'. #### Environment - Angular: 8.2.8 - CDK: 8.2.1 - Browser(s): Chrome v77.0.3865.90, Safari 13.0 - Operating System: macOS
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "OverlayPositionBuilder: Overlay position is not correct for some configurations" (#17237)

Issues.Title: Snackbar immediately closes if duration is above 1e+21
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Use StackBlitz to reproduce your issue: https://stackblitz.com/fork/components-issue

Steps to reproduce:
1. Open https://stackblitz.com/angular/jrnynrjaqdo
2. Display a snackbar with duration `durationInSeconds = 1e+21;` or `Number.MAX_VALUE`
3. Launch the snackbar
 
 
#### Expected Behavior

What behavior were you expecting to see?

The snackbar should be displayed for a (very) long time.

#### Actual Behavior

What behavior did you actually see?

Snackbar automatically closes itself after ~300ms.

It seems snackbar doesn't handle numbers with `e` format starting at `e+21`, eg it supports `1+e10` but not `1+e21` or above.

#### Environment

- Angular: 8.2.8
- CDK/Material: 8.2.1
- Browser(s): chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): ubuntu
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Snackbar immediately closes if duration is above 1e+21" (#17234)

Issues.Title: fix(drag-drop): not picking up indirect descendant items
Issues.Body:
Fixes that the drop list doesn't pick up drop items that aren't direct descendants. This was put in on purpose before to try and enforce a simpler DOM structure, but it could be limiting in some cases (e.g. if users want to put an `ngSwitch` with an `ng-container` around it).

These changes also add some extra logic to ensure that items aren't picked up by more than one ancestor list.

Fixes #17047.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(drag-drop): not picking up indirect descendant items" (#17226)

Issues.Title: prototype(progress-bar): create prototype progress bar based on MDC web
Issues.Body:
Implements the Angular Material progress bar on top of MDC web. The public API and behavior should be identical, aside from slight differences in the animation timings and easing curves.

**Note:** MDC's styles include an inline SVG which contains quotes and causes Bazel to create an invalid JS file when it tries to include the CSS in unit tests. These changes add a workaround where we exclude the progress bar theme from tests until the Bazel issue can be resolved.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "prototype(progress-bar): create prototype progress bar based on MDC web" (#17224)

Issues.Title: fix(overlay): block scroll strategy throwing off scroll behavior feature detection
Issues.Body:
To avoid a scrolling animation when we disable scrollig, we remove and re-set the `scroll-behavior` property on the body without feature checking it. The problem is that since we've set the property to *something*, our `scrollBehaviorSupported` feature check will be thrown off because it checks for `'scrollBehavior' in document.documentElement.style`.

Fixes #17221.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(overlay): block scroll strategy throwing off scroll behavior feature detection" (#17223)

Issues.Title: BlockScrollStrategy affects supportsScrollBehavior method in IE11
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Use StackBlitz to reproduce your issue: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-cdk-overlay-issue-apycr4

Steps to reproduce:
1. Open [example](https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-cdk-overlay-issue-apycr4) in IE11
2. Click "Open Dialog" button
3. Close Dialog
4. Click "Check supportsScrollBehavior" button
5. Open console
6. "ERROR!!! IE11 doesn't support scroll-behavior" message presented into the console
 
 
#### Expected Behavior

_BlockScrollStrategy.disable_ shouldn't add "scroll-behavior" style property to _html_ element by design.


#### Actual Behavior

_BlockScrollStrategy.disable_ was called by _MatDialog_ and it mutates style object of _html_ element by adding scrollBehavior property into it. Due to [specification](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/scroll-behavior) this property shouldn't be. And it affects also _supportsScrollBehavior_ method, because after _BlockScrollStrategy.disable_ call IE11 "supports" scroll-behavior, but it doesn't.


#### Environment

- Angular: 8.0+
- CDK/Material: 8.0+
- Browser(s): IE11
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows 10
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "BlockScrollStrategy affects supportsScrollBehavior method in IE11" (#17221)

Issues.Title: fix(select): highlighted option not updated if value is reset while closed
Issues.Body:
Currently we support the same feature as the native `select` where users can change the value and the focused option while the panel is closed using the arrow keys. The problem is that if the user changes the selected option and the value gets reset, the active option doesn't get updated so next time they interact with the control, it'll pick up from the previous position. These changes add an extra call to reset the highlighted option if the value is reset.

Fixes #17212.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(select): highlighted option not updated if value is reset while closed" (#17213)
